title.narrative: CAPACITIES OF SWF AND CP SYSTEM

description.narrative: Social welfare and child protection system has an enhanced capacity for and oversight of planning, provision and coordination of quality social and child protection interventions and services, in a culturally sensitive way, which contributes to Access To Inclusive Social Protection, Child Protection Systems, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Girls and boys, especially those affected by poverty, adversity and exclusion, progressively utilise quality, inclusive and efficient education system reinforced by policies, programmes and services for empowerment and participation, by 2022.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Social welfare and child protection system has an enhanced capacity for and oversight of planning, provision and coordination ofquality social and child protection interventions and services, in a culturally sensitive way

description.narrative: UNICEF supported national counterparts to better coordinate, implement and monitor policies and standards on social and child protection, including in response to COVID-19. The aim has been to strengthen system capacities to better serve the most vulnerable children and families during the pandemic by increasing reach and resilience of the system. Generating evidence, knowledge exchange, strengthening of the social service workforce and quality assurance of the system, proved to be key for improved support to the most vulnerable children and families;; | Status:On-track | As-of Date:23/01/2022
